titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Pacuska Camp Tamiment Photographs PHOTOS.258
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Schimke, 2013

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-07-25T11:32-0400

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: John Pacuska worked as a waiter at Camp Tamiment, an educational and recreational summer resort for socialists and their families located near Bushkill, Pennsylvania. The collection consists of ten pages of laser photocopies of 13 black-and-white photographs dating from 1951 to 1963, with captions written by Pacuska. The images are mostly group shots of Pacuska and the wait staff at Camp Tamiment.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2071. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; John Pacuska Camp Tamiment Photographs; PHOTOS 258; Box number; Folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of John Pacuska, 2007. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1950.252 and NPA.2008.034.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Materials have been rehoused in an archival folder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Pacuska was born in the coal mining town of Pittston, Pennsylvania. He served in the Navy for two years following World War II. In 1951, Pacuska and others from Pittston were recruited to work at Camp Tamiment, an educational and recreational summer resort for socialists and their families located near Bushkill, Pennsylvania. Pacuska worked as a waiter at the camp to help pay for his college education. He went on to have a career as a psychologist. Pacuska is retired and currently resides in Fountain Valley, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of ten pages of laser photocopies of 13 black-and-white photographs dating from 1951 to 1963, with captions written by Pacuska. The images are mostly group shots of Pacuska and the wait staff at Camp Tamiment, though there are also images of Pacuska with other camp staff and with the guests he served. Pacuksa's captions provide biographical information on specific staff members.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials at the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
